meanings.definition: The state or quality of being an adjutant.
meanings.sent1: Her adjutancies in the army were evident from her precise and organized manner.
meanings.sent2: The adjutancies of the officer included coordinating schedules and managing paperwork.
meanings.sent3: The adjutancies of the penguin in the zoo involved leading the daily march of the other animals.
meanings.sent4: In the world of bees, the adjutancies of the queen bee are crucial for the hive's survival.
meanings.sent5: The adjutancies of a conductor in an orchestra are akin to guiding a symphony of musicians.

meanings.definition: The duties or responsibilities of an adjutant.
meanings.sent1: Completing the adjutancies of the role required attention to detail and prompt execution.
meanings.sent2: The adjutancies of the position involved overseeing troop movements and communication.
meanings.sent3: The adjutancies of the cat as the household pet included napping in sunny spots and chasing toys.
meanings.sent4: The adjutancies of a teacher extend beyond the classroom to shaping young minds and fostering growth.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the adjutancies of a chef involves mastering various cooking techniques and flavor combinations.

meanings.definition: The office or position of an adjutant.
meanings.sent1: Securing the adjutancies in the military hierarchy required dedication and leadership skills.
meanings.sent2: The adjutancies of the role involved liaising between different units and ensuring smooth operations.
meanings.sent3: The adjutancies of the squirrel as the forest guardian included gathering nuts and scampering through trees.
meanings.sent4: In a bustling company, the adjutancies of a manager involve decision-making and team coordination.
meanings.sent5: The adjutancies of a captain on a ship are vital for navigation and maintaining discipline among the crew.
